newsitem.title: FRANCE: French COB signs exchange pact with Germany.
newsitem.headline: French COB signs exchange pact with Germany.

text.p: The COB French stockmarket regulator on Tuesday signed an an agreement to exchange information with its German counterpart, the BAWe.
Michel Prada of the Commission des Operations de Bourse and Georg Wittich of the Bundesaufsichtamt fur den Wertpapeirhandel signed the pact in Paris, the COB said in a statement.

The agreement sets rules for mutual assistance and covers information exchanges to allow the regulators to inquire into breaches in trading rules on securities and futures products. The pact is significant in the light of the forthcoming European investment services directive, the COB said. pnt
